sen.j: 青山 忠朝（あおやま ただとも）は江戸時代の大名、大坂城代。
sen.e: Tadatomo AOYAMA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of the Edo Period and was Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka-jo Castle).
Tadatomo AOYAMA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of the Edo Period and was Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka-jo Castle).
Tadatomo AOYAMA was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of the Edo Period and was Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka-jo Castle).

sen.j: 丹波亀山藩第3代藩主、同篠山藩初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the third lord of the Tanba-Kameyama domain and later, the first load of Tanba-Shinoyama domain.
He was the third lord of the Tanba-Kameyama Domain and later, the first load of Tanba-Shinoyama Domain.
sen.cmt: domain を Domain に修正しました。
sen.e: He was the third lord of the Tanba-Kameyama Domain and later, the first load of Tanba-Shinoyama Domain.
He was the seventh head of the Aoyama clan.
He was the seventh head of the Aoyama clan.
He was the seventh head of the Aoyama clan.

sen.j: 丹後国宮津藩主・青山幸督の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Yoshimasa AOYAMA who was the lord of the Tango-Miyazu Domain.
He was the second son of Yoshimasa AOYAMA who was the lord of the Tango-Miyazu Domain.
He was the second son of Yoshimasa AOYAMA who was the lord of the Tango-Miyazu Domain.

sen.j: 享保15年（1730年）、先代藩主・青山俊春が嗣子なく没したため、分家である丹後宮津藩から養子に入る。
sen.e: Since Toshiharu AOYAMA, the lord of the Tanba-Kameyama domain died without an heir, Tadatomo was adopted as his successor from a branch family which governed the Tango-Miyazu Domain.
Since Toshiharu AOYAMA, the lord of the Tanba-Kameyama Domain died without an heir, Tadatomo was adopted as his successor from a branch family which governed the Tango-Miyazu Domain.
sen.cmt: domain を Domain に修正しました。
sen.e: Since Toshiharu AOYAMA, the lord of the Tanba-Kameyama Domain died without an heir, Tadatomo was adopted as his successor from a branch family which governed the Tango-Miyazu Domain.

sen.j: しかし、忠朝も嗣子に恵まれなかったため、実兄・青山幸秀の子・青山忠高を養子に迎え後を継がせた。
sen.e: However, since Tadatomo himself did not have a child heir either, he adopted Tadataka AOYAMA, a son of his elder brother, to succeed to him.
However, since Tadatomo himself did not have a child heir either, he adopted Tadataka AOYAMA, a son of his elder brother, to succeed to him.
However, since Tadatomo himself did not have a child heir either, he adopted Tadataka AOYAMA, a son of his elder brother, to succeed to him.

-He started serving as Sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies).

He started serving as Sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies).

sen.j: - 寺社奉行、篠山に国替（共に8月3日 (旧暦)）
sen.e: -He was appointed as a jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) and at the same time his domain to govern was changed from Kameyama to Shinoyama (on August 26).
-He was appointed as a jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) and at the same time his domain to govern was changed from Kameyama to Shinoyama (on August 26).

tit.cmt: court ranks を Court Ranks に修正しました。

sen.e: -He received the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the title of Hoki no kami (honorary governor of Hoki province).
-He received the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and the title of Hoki no kami (governor of Hoki province).
